content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Brickworks Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(May 2021)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Brickworks Constituency** was a constituency in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It used to exist from 1976 to 1988. It merged part of Leng Kee and Pasir Panjang. ## History In 1988, the constituency was merged into [Brickworks GRC](/wiki/Brickworks_Group_Representation_Constituency) following the establishment of [Group representation constituency](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) (GRC) and [Single Member Constituency](/wiki/Single_Member_Constituency) (SMC). ## Member of Parliament **Election** **Member****Party****Formation****(/wiki/1976_Singaporean_general_election)**[Ahmad Mattar](/wiki/Ahmad_Mattar)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**(/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election)****(/wiki/1984_Singaporean_general_election)****Constituency abolished (1988)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1970s [General Election 1976](/wiki/1976_Singaporean_general_election) PartyCandidateVotes%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****[Ahmad Mattar](/wiki/Ahmad_Mattar)** **9,871** **73.99** United FrontTung Tao-Chang alias Shums3,47026.01Majority47.986,401Total valid votesRejected ballots[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)13,34194.87[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)14,062[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **win** (new seat) ### Elections in 1980s [General Election 1980](/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election) PartyCandidateVotes%±%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****[Ahmad Mattar](/wiki/Ahmad_Mattar)*****Unopposed***[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)13,0547.17[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **hold**[General Election 1984](/wiki/1984_Singaporean_general_election) PartyCandidateVotes%±%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****[Ahmad Mattar](/wiki/Ahmad_Mattar)** **8,389** **66.27** **N/A** [WP](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_of_Singapore)Mohd Taib B Saffar4,27033.73N/A[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)4,11932.54N/ATotal valid votes12,65997.75N/ARejected ballots2922.25N/A[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)12,95195.43N/A[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)13,5713.96[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **hold**[Swing](/wiki/Swing_(politics))N/A This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub.
